lead_paragraph: At a hearing in the State Senate, several lawmakers said they were troubled by the agency’s aggressive collections tactics and unwillingness to negotiate with borrowers.

byline.contributor: Annie Waldman is a reporter for ProPublica, an independent, nonprofit newsroom that produces investigative journalism in the public interest.

headline.print_headline: Targeting Tough Tactics of Student Loan Agency
headline.main: Legislators Take Aim at New Jersey Student Loan Program’s Tough Tactics

snippet: At a hearing in the State Senate, several lawmakers said they were troubled by the agency’s aggressive collections tactics and unwillingness to negotiate with borrowers....
abstract: New Jersey legislators take aim at state’s Higher Education Student Assistance Authority, which charges students higher interest rates than similar federal programs, pushing forward with two measure that would give break to borrowers.
